intro: Carum siifolium, commonly known as Siberian cow parsley. It is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of Siberia and the Caucasus. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-shaped flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a peppery or spicy scent when crushed. Carum siifolium is typically found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates.
